column15: Constantine was originally visually inspired by Sting from The Police because his artists were "obsessed" with the singer (Riesman 2014)

Montoya started off as a cop in Gotham's Major Crimes Unit, but left after her partner in the force got killed. She became an alcoholic, then the Question's helper and mentee, and finally assumed the role as the vigilante Question herself (Lam 2015)

column11: Who's Who in the DC Universe #14
column15: Originally, Obsidian was the son of Green Lantern and Rose Canton, who had a villanous alter ego named Thorn. He was put up for adoption and was raised in an abusive home afterwards. Later, he turned into a villain for a time period due to inherited mental health problems from his mother (Lam 2016)
J.H. Williams III and W. Haden Blackman left DC's Batwoman creative team after the publisher refused to let Kate Kane (Batwoman) marry Maggie Sawyer (Polo 2013)
Despite being born deaf, Hartley's wealthy background allowed him to be medically cured from the condition, prompting him to become "fascinated with sound" (Paige 2015)
